alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:50AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Putnam and central Bureau Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 448 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Wyanet, or 10 miles northwest of Princeton, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Lightning, brief heavy rain, and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wyanet around 500 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Princeton, Tiskilwa, Hennepin, DePue and Bureau Junction. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 39 and 68. Interstate 180 between mile markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
